title: Lydiard Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Mike Searle / Lydiard House, Lydiard Park - Swindon
images.caption: Lydiard House

images.title: Chris Randall / The lake in Lydiard Park
images.caption: The lake in Lydiard Park. After many years virtually empty, the lake has been fully restored to its original 18th Century proportions. The work was completed during the summer of 2006, and is part of a group of major projects funded by the Heritage Lottery plus other local and national sponsors.

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Ha-Ha, Lydiard Park, Swindon
images.caption: The Ha-Ha. Kept the deer away from the house without unsightly fences.

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Walled garden, Lydiard Park, Swindon
images.caption: Walled garden

images.caption: The cafe

description: Located on the edge of Swindon is this splendid park with 260 acres of lawns, woodlands and pasture for visitors to walk or cycle through. Here you will find the beautifully-restored State Rooms of Lydiard House, with its original furnishings and portrait gallery. There is also an ornamental fruit and flower Walled Garden and a children's play area. To continue your walking in the area you could head to the nearby Mouldon Hill Country Park . Here you'll find a pretty lake, the River Ray, a section of the North Wilts Canal and nice views from the park's high points. About a mile to the north east you'll find Shaw Forest Park . The park has nice footpaths with ash/willow woodland, wildflower meadows, grassland and ponds. There's also Peatmoor Lake where there is a nice walking trail to try. Our circular Swindon Cycle Route visits all these parks using signed cycle routes which run through the town.
